column4: hey guys, what was the name of that mouse util used to capture mouse movement and button clicks within a little square?
it was packaged with Xorg I think
xev?
ahhh thank you
is this a shell script?
no, it's a binary
what does "file <filename>" report?
http://pastebin.com/gSBTEQfe
gnu/linux 2.2.5? which version of the c library was this linked against?
also, just for fun, try "ldd pclient"
argh I have no idea =/. ldd says it's not dynamically linked though
file claims it is :-)
yes, strange eh? http://pastebin.com/by4WP0f1
my guess? the binary is linked against glibc 5. don't suppose you have access to source code?
unfortunately not. It's a ridiculous binary package from Sun which was built for RHEL/SUSE but I'm trying to get working on 10.04 so our hardware will work.
well, at least you know who to call :-)
which versions of RHEL/SuSE do they claim are compatible?
RHEL 5u1. Actually I found a list of required packages in a manual. Page 9: http://dlc.sun.com/pdf/820-5749-12/820-5749-12.pdf
out of curiosity, are you running this on a 64-bit ubuntu? do you have a libc in your /lib32 directory?
arrrgh I think that may have been it
yes, it works now. Oh man that was epic fail. I'm sorry for wasting your time =/
no trouble, it's a subtle error to catch
